title: Parallelogram law
text:
In <a href="mathematics">mathematics</a>, the simplest form of the parallelogram law (also called the parallelogram identity) belongs to elementary <a href="geometry">geometry</a>. It states that the sum of the squares of the lengths of the four sides of a <a href="parallelogram">parallelogram</a> equals the sum of the squares of the lengths of the two diagonals. We use these notations for the sides: "AB", "BC", "CD", "DA".
